snippet: In 2006, a scout named Steve Barningham lobbied the Mets to draft Murphy, beginning their longtime friendship and never-ending conversation about hitting.
abstract: New York Mets scout Steve Barningham lobbied team to sign infielder Daniel Murphy in 2006, one of most important moves in recent Mets history; Murphy became first player in baseball to hit home runs in six consecutive postseason games as he led team to its first pennant in 15 years and is one home run away from tying record for home runs in postseason, which is eight; Barningham and Murphy have cultivated deep friendship over years.
lead_paragraph: In 2006, a scout named Steve Barningham lobbied the Mets to draft Murphy, beginning their longtime friendship and never-ending conversation about hitting.

headline.print_headline: The Unearthing of a Prolific Bat
headline.main: The Scout Who Loved Daniel Murphy’s Swing Before Anyone Else
